heroIntro: Welcome to a new chapter of peaceful, relaxed living in Playa Flamenca, where Mediterranean sunshine meets genuine community. This beautifully appointed 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment offers the perfect balance of comfort and value for those seeking a leisurely retirement lifestyle on the Costa Blanca. At €325,000, you're acquiring premium specification at €4,452/m² – remarkably, 35% less than comparable properties in Costa Blanca North – making this an exceptional opportunity for discerning buyers. Playa Flamenca has become a haven for the international expat community, particularly British, Scandinavian, and Dutch retirees who appreciate its relaxed atmosphere, excellent year-round sunshine, and proximity to world-class healthcare facilities. The 73m² layout has been thoughtfully designed for modern living, with two generous bedrooms and two full bathrooms ensuring comfort for you and visiting family. Located in the heart of Orihuela Costa's most sought-after residential area, this property places you within easy reach of golden beaches, championship golf courses, and a vibrant yet peaceful community where English is widely spoken and international residents thrive.
areaSection: Orihuela Costa represents one of southern Spain's most established and well-developed Mediterranean destinations, stretching along the Alicante coastline between Torrevieja and Guardamar del Segura. This region boasts consistent year-round sunshine with over 300 days of brilliant Mediterranean climate, making it ideal for retirees seeking respite from colder northern climates. The area has matured beautifully over the past two decades, transforming from quiet fishing villages into cosmopolitan communities with world-class infrastructure. Playa Flamenca itself sits at the heart of this development, offering authentic Spanish charm combined with modern European conveniences. The geography is predominantly flat and accessible, with the glittering Mediterranean just minutes away. The region's natural beauty is complemented by carefully maintained green spaces, tree-lined avenues, and thoughtful urban planning that respects the environment whilst providing contemporary living standards. The microclimate here is particularly favourable – slightly warmer and drier than inland areas, yet refreshed by Atlantic breezes that prevent oppressive summer heat.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Orihuela Costa revolves around enjoying the very best of Mediterranean culture at a relaxed pace. Your mornings might begin with a paseo along Playa Flamenca's promenade, followed by café con leche at one of numerous beachfront chiringuitos where English-speaking staff understand exactly what you're after. The international expat community – predominantly British, Dutch, and Scandinavian – has created a wonderfully welcoming environment where you'll find English spoken everywhere, yet authentic Spanish culture remains vibrant. Lunch is taken seriously here; mid-week you might explore family-run restaurants in nearby Orihuela town, or simply enjoy paella at your favourite beach spot. Afternoons offer endless possibilities: a game of golf at nearby Villamartín, shopping at La Zenia Boulevard, or simply relaxing poolside reading whilst the Mediterranean breeze catches your book. The weekly markets in Orihuela provide fresh produce and authentic local colour, and the shopping centres offer everything from international brands to practical necessities. Healthcare access is excellent with English-speaking doctors readily available. Evenings bring a gentle social calendar – dinner clubs, expat meetups, and Spanish cultural events ensure you're never lonely, yet the pace remains refreshingly unhurried.
investmentSection: Beyond the lifestyle benefits, this property represents solid financial sense. Orihuela Costa has experienced consistent +10% year-on-year price appreciation, reflecting strong underlying demand from retiring professionals and international investors. At €4,452/m², you're acquiring premium specification – comparable to €6,800-7,200/m² in Costa Blanca North – representing exceptional value. The rental market remains robust; similar 2-bedroom properties command €700-900 per week during peak season, translating to €30,000-40,000 annual rental income if you choose to let during months you're away. Many owners successfully balance personal use with income generation, covering running costs whilst maintaining flexibility. The property's location in established Playa Flamenca ensures continued demand from both holiday-makers and long-term residents. With Portugal's Golden Visa programme creating interest from non-EU investors and continued immigration from northern Europe, Orihuela Costa remains one of Spain's most resilient property markets.
conclusion: This 2-bedroom apartment in Playa Flamenca represents more than property acquisition – it's your gateway to a peaceful, enriched retirement lifestyle in one of Europe's most established Mediterranean communities. At €325,000 with premium specification at 35% discount to comparable North Costa Blanca properties, combined with +10% annual appreciation and strong rental income potential, this is both lifestyle choice and sound investment. The abundance of world-class healthcare, championship golf, beautiful beaches, and thriving international community create the ideal environment for retirees seeking year-round sunshine without compromising modern conveniences. With only 35 professional photographs available and strong interest in this category, we recommend early viewing to fully appreciate this opportunity. Contact us today via WhatsApp at your convenience – our bilingual team are available to answer questions, arrange viewings, or discuss financing options. Your Mediterranean retirement awaits.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Orihuela Costa has evolved into a fully self-contained modern community where retirees enjoy every convenience whilst maintaining the relaxed Mediterranean pace of life. From healthcare to shopping, everything is accessible and English-speaker friendly.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Orihuela Costa is exceptional, with numerous options for private and public medical care. Hospital de Torrevieja, just 15 minutes away, is a modern private facility offering comprehensive emergency, surgical, and specialist services. Quirónsalud, another excellent private hospital, is 20 minutes distant. The area hosts multiple medical centres staffed by English-speaking doctors who understand the needs of international residents. Dental clinics, physiotherapy, and specialist services are abundant and considerably less expensive than northern Europe. The climate itself is therapeutic – the year-round sunshine and gentle Mediterranean air support cardiovascular and respiratory health.
keyPoints: Hospital de Torrevieja – 15 minutes, modern private facility with 24-hour emergency department
English-speaking doctors – available at multiple clinics throughout the area
Quirónsalud – 20 minutes, comprehensive private healthcare with all specialties
Prescription medications – significantly less expensive than UK/Northern Europe

education.text: Whilst primarily attractive to retirees, Orihuela Costa offers excellent international school options for visiting grandchildren or younger family members. El Limonar International School provides British and Spanish curriculum education just 15 minutes away, with excellent facilities and experienced international staff. Kings College Murcia, 40 minutes distant, offers another quality alternative following British educational standards. The presence of these schools reflects the area's commitment to attracting families and supporting international residents long-term.
keyPoints: El Limonar International School – 15 minutes, British and Spanish curriculum
Kings College Murcia – 40 minutes, established British-style education
Orihuela University – 8 km, if cultural or educational pursuits interest you

shopping.text: Shopping in Orihuela Costa is remarkably convenient. La Zenia Boulevard, just 3 km away, is a major shopping centre with over 150 shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues – everything from Carrefour supermarket to international brands. For daily necessities, Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl supermarkets are scattered throughout the area, all stocking familiar brands and international products. Weekly markets in nearby Orihuela provide authentic Spanish produce, fresh fish, and local specialities at exceptional prices. The combination ensures you'll never lack convenience whilst maintaining the option to shop authentically Spanish when desired.

transport.text: Orihuela Costa is exceptionally well-positioned for access across the region. Alicante Airport, 50 km away (approximately 45 minutes' drive), offers direct flights to the UK, Scandinavia, northern Europe, and connections worldwide – essential for retirees maintaining international ties. Public transport exists but is limited; a car is recommended and highly practical given the Costa Blanca's geography. Driving throughout the area is straightforward with excellent road infrastructure. Petrol remains inexpensive compared to northern Europe, and maintenance/insurance costs are similarly favourable. Many residents find the freedom of car ownership outweighs public transport limitations.

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa a good place to live?
faqs.answer: Yes, Orihuela Costa is an excellent choice for retirement living. It offers year-round Mediterranean sunshine (300+ days annually), established international expat communities where English is widely spoken, world-class healthcare facilities, beautiful beaches, and championship golf courses. The cost of living is approximately 30-40% lower than Northern Europe whilst maintaining modern European standards of living.

faqs.question: What is Orihuela Costa known for?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa is renowned as Spain's premier retirement destination, particularly popular with British, Scandinavian, and Dutch retirees. It's famous for its excellent year-round climate, Blue Flag beaches, championship golf courses (especially Villamartín), thriving expat communities, and balanced lifestyle combining Mediterranean relaxation with modern conveniences and healthcare access.

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa safe?
faqs.answer: Yes, Orihuela Costa is considered safe and secure, with established residential communities, modern infrastructure, and visible security throughout. Gated communities like this property's are standard, and the area has a strong police presence. The international communities are well-established and experienced residents consistently report feeling secure.

faqs.question: How far is Orihuela Costa from Alicante?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa is approximately 50 km south of Alicante city centre, roughly 45 minutes' drive via the motorway. Alicante Airport is 50 km away (45 minutes), offering direct international flights to the UK, Scandinavia, and across Europe – convenient for maintaining ties with family and friends abroad.

faqs.question: What is the rental income potential from this property?
faqs.answer: Similar 2-bedroom apartments in Playa Flamenca command €700-900 per week during peak season, translating to approximately €30,000-40,000 annually if let throughout the year. Many owners maintain personal use during winter months whilst letting during summer, effectively covering running costs. This property's modern specifications and prime location support strong rental demand.

faqs.question: What are the property running costs?
faqs.answer: Annual costs typically include: community fees (€80-120 monthly for maintenance and amenities), annual property tax/IBI (€200-300), utilities including air conditioning/heating (€100-150 monthly depending on usage), and insurance (€300-500 annually). Total annual costs are generally €2,500-3,500 – significantly less than Northern European equivalents.

faqs.question: Are there golf courses nearby?
faqs.answer: Yes, Villamartín Golf Club is just 2 km away – one of Spain's finest championship courses. Additional courses within 5 km include Campoamor, Las Ramblas, Las Colinas, and Vistabella. This concentration of quality courses makes Orihuela Costa ideal for golf-loving retirees, with membership and green fee options available.

faqs.question: How good is the healthcare in Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: Healthcare is excellent with Hospital de Torrevieja (15 minutes) and Quirónsalud (20 minutes) providing modern private facilities with full emergency and specialist services. English-speaking doctors are abundant throughout the area. Prescription costs are 40-60% lower than the UK, and private healthcare is generally more affordable than public options in Northern Europe.
